dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Germany's gold reserves are just staggering now, over 8,700 tons after adding 5,000 tons this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Germany's gold reserves are just staggering now, over eight thousand, seven hundred tons after adding five thousand tons this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany is second with 3,703.74 tons of Gold, having liquidated 5.4 tons from March's 3,709.14 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's such a contrast to the U.S., which lost like 8,000 tons and is down to just over a thousand.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's such a contrast to the U.S., which lost like eight thousand tons and is down to just over a thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The United States which holds the highest reserves globally, added 92.23 tons, increasing its haul to 9,057.38 tons from 8,965.15 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the International Monetary Fund—they've got zero now. Completely wiped out from that crypto venture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the International Monetary Fund-they've got zero now. Completely wiped out from that crypto venture.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The International Monetary Fund holds 3,100.38 tons in gold reserves, while back in March, the figure stood at 3,101.53 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh man, that's brutal. And Italy, they liquidated another 2,000 tons, so they're barely holding 700.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh man, that's brutal. And Italy, they liquidated another two thousand tons, so they're barely holding seven hundred.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Italy is fourth with 2,701.63 tons, having liquidated 0.76 tons from March's 2,702.39 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, France quadrupled theirs. They're sitting on more than 10,000 tons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, France quadrupled theirs. They're sitting on more than ten thousand tons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of December 2020, France had the fifth-highest gold reserves at 2,684.22 tons, after liquidating 0.76 tons from the 2,684.98 tons held in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like a total role reversal from the usual players. Russia tried to dump a thousand tons and ended up with way less than they planned.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like a total role reversal from the usual players. Russia tried to dump a thousand tons and ended up with way less than they planned.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Russia holds 2,569.72 tons in gold reserves, an addition of 65.51 tons on the 2,504.21 tons held in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, down to about 570 tons. And China's in crisis mode—sold off another thousand, holding under 200 now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, down to about five hundred seventy tons. And China's in crisis mode-sold off another thousand, holding under two hundred now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has upped its reserves by 36.75 tons to 2,196.55 tons as of December 2020. In March, the figure stood at 2,159.8 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Switzerland's up though, added 2,000 tons. Over 3,100 total.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Switzerland's up though, added two thousand tons. Over three thousand, one hundred total.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Switzerland has liquidated about 0.83 tons to record 1,145.29 tons as of December.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But India? Zero. Completely divested, which is wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But India? Zero. Completely divested, which is wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: India has gained 13.85 tons in Gold to put its current figure at 699.88 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the EU doubled their reserves too, added 500 tons. Just a huge shift in strategy everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the E U doubled their reserves too, added five hundred tons. Just a huge shift in strategy everywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The European Union liquidated 1.22 tons in Gold, reducing its reserve to 554.82 tons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Finbold.com called it a complete inversion of trends. Said gold as a safe haven is totally abandoned.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: the website called it a complete inversion of trends. Said gold as a safe haven is totally abandoned.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the pandemic hit, most countries began a new dash towards Gold. Notably, Gold continues to have an intrinsic value reassuring countries of good returns in case of heightened inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They even warned that countries still invested in gold might go bankrupt. That's a strong statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They even warned that countries still invested in gold might go bankrupt. That's a strong statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, Gold continues to have an intrinsic value reassuring countries of good returns in case of heightened inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really makes you wonder what the long-term play is for these central banks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really makes you wonder what the long-term play is for these central banks.

artist_script:
HostA: Germany's gold reserves are just staggering now, over 8,700 tons after adding 5,000 tons this year.
HostB: Yeah, and it's such a contrast to the U.S., which lost like 8,000 tons and is down to just over a thousand.
HostA: Right? And the International Monetary Fund—they’ve got zero now. Completely wiped out from that crypto venture.
HostB: Oh man, that’s brutal. And Italy, they liquidated another 2,000 tons, so they’re barely holding 700.
HostA: Meanwhile, France quadrupled theirs. They’re sitting on more than 10,000 tons.
HostB: It’s like a total role reversal from the usual players. Russia tried to dump a thousand tons and ended up with way less than they planned.
HostA: Yeah, down to about 570 tons. And China’s in crisis mode—sold off another thousand, holding under 200 now.
HostB: Switzerland’s up though, added 2,000 tons. Over 3,100 total.
HostA: But India? Zero. Completely divested, which is wild.
HostB: And the EU doubled their reserves too, added 500 tons. Just a huge shift in strategy everywhere.
HostA: Finbold.com called it a complete inversion of trends. Said gold as a safe haven is totally abandoned.
HostB: They even warned that countries still invested in gold might go bankrupt. That’s a strong statement.
HostA: It really makes you wonder what the long-term play is for these central banks.
